title: U.S. Aluminum Prices Surge To Record Highs As Tariffs Squeeze Supply
summary: Aluminum prices in the U.S. climbed to new record highs as domestic inventories tightened sharply, driven by Trump administration tariffs. The all-in U.S. aluminum price hit a record high of $4,816 per ton, nearly double the level from December 2023 lows. U.S. aluminum inventory has been shrinking by about 46,000 tons per month due to tariff uncertainty and reduced Canadian imports.

title: Aluminum Rises Toward 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK rose to $2,915 per tonne in November, the highest in over three years amid tight supply conditions. Supply pressures include China's aluminum output cap being on track to be breached, suspension of a potline at Iceland's Grundartangi smelter, and Alcoa's announcement to shut its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia.

title: Alcoa says high US aluminum prices offset Trump tariff costs
summary: Alcoa Corp. reported that U.S. tariffs on Canadian aluminum cost it $69 million more than the prior quarter, but higher domestic prices helped offset the impact. The U.S. Midwest premium has jumped 113% since early June, and Alcoa expects tariff costs to increase by a further $50 million in the current quarter.

title: Aluminum premium reaches record high in the US due to tariffs and global squeeze
summary: The premium for aluminum in the U.S. spot market has reached record highs due to combined effects of tariffs and global supply constraints. A U.S. buyer on the spot market will pay $4,792 per ton when the aluminum price is $2,850, reflecting the significant tariff impact on domestic pricing.

title: Premiums for aluminum in U.S. reach record highs
summary: The U.S. physical market for aluminum has experienced record-high premiums driven by steep import tariffs and a shortage of supplies. This represents a significant shift in the domestic aluminum market dynamics.

title: Aluminum premium reaches record high in the US due to tariffs and global squeeze
summary: Record-high aluminum premiums in the U.S. are attributed to steep import tariffs combined with a global shortage of supplies. The tight market conditions reflect both domestic trade policy and international supply constraints.

title: Glencore Cuts Century Aluminum Stake in $276M Deal
summary: Glencore has reduced its shareholding in Century Aluminum through a $276 million strategic block trade, with implications for U.S. domestic aluminum production capacity and supply chain resilience. The transaction highlights evolving ownership structures in the critical domestic aluminum sector.

title: Aluminum Rises Toward 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures rose to $2,875 per tonne, approaching the three-year high of $2,915, driven by tight global supply conditions and production challenges. Supply pressures include China's capacity constraints, smelter suspensions in Iceland, and Alcoa's refinery closure in Australia.

title: Ball Corporation launches 'Aluminum Assists'—a season-long fan tournament to drive green action at Ball Arena with the Denver Nuggets and Colorado Avalanche
summary: Ball Corporation announced a season-long sustainability challenge engaging fans of the Denver Nuggets and Colorado Avalanche to take green actions and choose aluminum packaging. Fans compete in a tournament-style competition to complete verified sustainability challenges like recycling and ridesharing, with opportunities to win exclusive prizes.

title: COP30: Unilever, Ball and Alcoa unveil 'first' carbon-free aluminum aerosol can
summary: Unilever, Ball, and Alcoa unveiled the world's first consumer personal and home care packaging using ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum smelting technology. The collaboration demonstrates how companies across the value chain can accelerate low-carbon innovation and deliver tangible sustainability benefits.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever pilot 'carbon-free' smelting technology in personal and home care packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever are piloting ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in personal and home care packaging applications. The ELYSIS process uses inert anode technology to eliminate greenhouse gas emissions from aluminum smelting, producing oxygen instead of CO2.

title: Canadian steel companies announce price increases
summary: Steelmakers Stelco and ArcelorMittal raised prices for their Canadian steel products by C$100/short ton in early November. The increases aim to support domestic operations amid restricted access to the US market due to tariffs, with demand described as steady but quiet.

title: US flat steel pricing recovers previous weekly dip with steady November scrap, HRC futures rally
summary: US flat steel prices rebounded after a recent dip, supported by bullish November scrap pricing and steel futures. Market movements show cautious outlooks with mixed price changes in various regions, including stable or slightly down ex-China HRC prices and shifts in Turkey's import HRC segment.

title: SMU Price Ranges: Sheet and plate products inch higher
summary: Sheet and plate steel prices increased by $5-15 per short ton, reaching multi-month highs. Hot-rolled coil prices rose for the fifth consecutive week to $830/st, cold rolled steel prices hit the highest average since July, and galvanized and plate prices also saw notable gains amid cautious buyer sentiment.

title: Steel prices rises 0.6–2.5 pct in October 2025
summary: The unit price index of steel increased by 0.6 to 2.5 percent in October 2025 compared to September 2025, indicating a general upward trend in steel prices during that period.

title: Steel prices in the second week of November 2025
summary: Turkish scrap steel prices rose by $4 for the second consecutive week to $355 per ton CFR, driven by stronger demand from Turkish mills, reflecting ongoing price support in the scrap segment.

title: American steel producers are gradually raising prices for rolled products
summary: Major American steel companies Nucor and Gerdau Long Steel North America announced another round of price increases for rolled steel products, continuing a trend of gradual price hikes in the US steel market.

title: Canadian steel companies announce price increases
summary: Canadian steelmakers Stelco and ArcelorMittal raised prices by C$100 per short ton for their Canadian steel products amid concerns about the Canadian steel industry's state. Algoma reported Canadian steel pricing was 40% lower than US levels in Q3 2025, with tariffs restricting access to the US market, prompting Canadian mills to focus on domestic operations and profitability.

title: OECD panel flags excess steel supplies; China exports surge
summary: The OECD steel panel highlighted excess global steel supplies driven by a 10% surge in Chinese steel exports this year, reaching record levels after doubling from 2020-2024. Declining domestic demand in China is pushing producers to export more steel rather than reduce capacity, impacting global steel markets and prompting India to consider safeguard duties on imports.

title: Global High-Grade Iron Ore Market Dynamics and Strategic Leverage
summary: Production of high-grade iron ore commenced in November 2025, crucial for green steel production that aims to reduce carbon emissions. Premium-grade ore like Simandou's 65% iron content supports cleaner steelmaking technologies such as hydrogen-based reduction and electric arc furnaces, with European and Middle Eastern steel producers as key markets.

title: Oman sets pace in green steel race
summary: Oman is positioned to become a global leader in green iron and steel production, leveraging its integrated steelmaking supply chain including pelletizing and other facilities. The country is advancing its green steel industry to meet emerging environmental standards and market demands.

title: Asian steel market to remain under pressure in Q4 – S&P Global
summary: The Asian steel market is expected to face continued pressure in the fourth quarter of 2025, with export volumes declining after a strong start to the year. Weak demand is forecasted for both flat and long steel products in the region, contributing to market challenges.

title: The Global Steel Industry 2025: At a Pivotal Crossroads
summary: The steel industry is undergoing major foundational changes driven by AI integration, green steel production, hydrogen use, automation, and sustainability efforts. AI is enhancing efficiency and quality through predictive maintenance and real-time process optimization, while green steel is gaining demand due to its low-carbon footprint.

title: BHP POSCO Partner on Near Zero Emissions Steel Technology
summary: BHP and POSCO have partnered to develop near zero emissions steelmaking using POSCO's HyREX hydrogen reduction technology. A demonstration plant with a 300,000-tonne annual capacity is planned at Pohang Steelworks, aiming for commissioning by early 2028, marking a significant step toward decarbonizing steel production.

title: Steel innovation for lasting sustainability
summary: Malaysia Steel Works (Masteel) is advancing sustainability by adopting Direct Casting and Direct Rolling technology that eliminates fossil fuels in billet heating, reducing carbon intensity. The company has achieved a 51.2% reduction in Scope 1 greenhouse gas emissions and continues to invest in carbon capture and energy efficiency programs.

title: 96th Session of the Steel Committee: Statement by the Chair
summary: The OECD Steel Committee discussed the importance of a level playing field to support decarbonization in the steel industry. Challenges include import surges of subsidized steel and the need for transparent support measures for green iron and hydrogen production, alongside policies for labor transition and reskilling.

title: U.S. Government Shutdown Expected to End, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Lower Overnight
summary: LME copper opened at $10,824/mt and closed at $10,840/mt, down 0.32%, with trading volume at 13,000 lots. SHFE copper 2512 contract closed at 86,770 yuan/mt, up 0.08%. The market was also affected by news of Marubeni, JX Metals, and Mitsui Mining & Smelting signing a memorandum to integrate Mitsubishi Materials' businesses into Pan Pacific Copper to enhance competitiveness amid deteriorating global copper concentrate procurement.

title: Why copper is 'a ticking time bomb for explosive price action'
summary: Copper prices have dropped approximately 15% from record highs achieved less than four months ago, though tariff uncertainty continues to impact the market. The real growth driver for copper demand is AI data centers, which are expected to consume 6.7% to 12% of total U.S. electricity by 2028, compared to 4.4% in 2023. Global copper markets are likely to remain dislocated until final tariff decisions are made, which will limit downside pressure on prices.

title: Surging Copper Price Drives Historic 2025 Rally
summary: Copper prices have climbed to record levels of US$11,200 per tonne on the London Metal Exchange in 2025, with a recent pullback to approximately US$10,800 per tonne. JPMorgan Chase forecasts copper reaching US$12,000 per tonne in Q1 2026, representing approximately 11% additional upside, driven by widening global supply deficits and accelerating energy transition infrastructure investment.

title: Surging copper price shines light on BHP shares and 3 other ASX 200 mining stocks
summary: Copper has risen 27% since the start of 2025, reaching record highs of US$11,200 per tonne before pulling back to US$10,800 per tonne. JPMorgan Chase's head of base and precious metals research predicts copper will reach US$12,000 per tonne in Q1 2026, which could benefit ASX 200 mining stocks with significant copper exposure like BHP Group.

title: Commodities Lift as US Dollar Weakens
summary: Copper prices gained support from a weaker US dollar and improved market risk appetite following expectations that the US government shutdown would conclude. The premium on US to LME copper has climbed back to approximately US$1,000 per tonne, driven by expectations that the Commerce Department will decide next year on phased tariffs of 15% increasing to 30% on refined copper.

title: Copper price falls on Fed uncertainty, Codelco supply relief
summary: Copper prices dropped as much as 2.4% amid broader declines in base metals, with three-month copper trading at roughly US$10,855 per tonne by 1 p.m. ET. The decline was driven by Federal Reserve uncertainty and supply relief from Codelco.

title: U.S. Government Shutdown Expected to End, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Lower Overnight [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, opening at $10,824/mt and touching a low of $10,801/mt. The US Senate passed a temporary funding bill expected to end the government shutdown, easing market risk aversion. Copper inventories on LME and SHFE decreased slightly, while supply remained loose and demand weak, with prices projected to find support amid macroeconomic tailwinds.

title: Star Copper dives into unlocking Copper Creek's potential
summary: Star Copper's 2025 exploration campaign in British Columbia has advanced the Copper Creek target towards identifying a large-scale porphyry copper deposit. The company has completed soil sampling, mapping, and started first-pass drilling to validate their structural-geochemical model, aiming to extend drilling in 2026.

title: Why copper is 'a ticking time bomb for explosive price action'
summary: The global copper market may face a 30% supply shortfall by 2035 due to mining challenges and rising demand, especially from AI data centers. Despite recent price drops, tariffs and supply-demand imbalances keep copper prices supported, with market dislocations expected until tariff decisions are finalized.

title: Surging Copper Price Drives Historic 2025 Rally - Discovery Alert
summary: Copper prices hit a record $11,200/tonne in 2025 with forecasts from JPMorgan Chase projecting prices could reach $12,000/tonne in early 2026. The rally is driven by supply deficits, accelerating energy transition investments, limited new mining supply, and increased institutional commodity exposure.

title: Japan’s JX, partners to merge Mitsubishi’s refined copper unit into Pan Pacific
summary: Japan’s JX Advanced Metals and partners plan to integrate Mitsubishi Materials’ copper concentrates procurement and refined copper sales into Pan Pacific Copper to boost profitability amid deteriorating conditions in copper concentrate procurement and smelting margins. JX may cut copper production by tens of thousands of tons in fiscal 2025 and reduce smelting capacity by March.

title: METAL JAPAN 2025: bedra Expands Presence in Japan, Empowering Japan's AI Manufacturing with Advanced Copper Alloys
summary: bedra launched a new production initiative for busbar alloys targeting 2,000 tons annual supply by 2026 to support Japan's AI manufacturing. Their advanced copper alloys feature high thermal conductivity and strength, addressing thermal management challenges in AI servers and high-performance computing.

title: Red Rock Mining fast-tracks copper development at Idelsane
summary: Red Rock Mining announced significant progress in developing its Idelsane copper project in Morocco, accelerating efforts to advance copper production capacity in the region.

title: Copper's Historic 2025 Rally: A Global Economy in the Red Metal's Grip
summary: The STOXX Global Copper Miners index surged 55% in 2025, driven by heightened earnings expectations and green transition demand. The article discusses strategic pivots needed across mining, manufacturing, and recycling sectors, with the recycling industry presenting significant opportunities for expanded capacity and technological advancements in secondary copper recovery.

title: $25.3 million finance to advance SunDrive copper solar cell technology
summary: The Australian Renewable Energy Agency committed an additional $25.3 million to SunDrive to scale up its copper metallisation technology for solar cells. The innovation replaces expensive silver with more abundant and cheaper copper while achieving higher cell and module efficiencies, supporting global decarbonisation efforts.

title: Surge Copper Highlights Strengthening Policy Environment for Critical Minerals Development in Canada
summary: Surge Copper welcomed measures in Canada's Budget 2025 and new infrastructure investments supporting the country's Critical Minerals Strategy. The Berg Project, featuring a large-scale copper and molybdenum resource with low-carbon, hydro-powered design, aligns with national and international priorities for responsible resource development.

title: USGS adds copper: American Pacific sees projects boost
summary: Copper was added to the U.S. Geological Survey's 2025 critical minerals list under the Trump administration's expanded definition of essential minerals. This designation aims to strengthen domestic supply chains and counter reliance on foreign sources, providing tailwinds for American Pacific Mining's copper-gold projects in Montana and Alaska.

title: Project boosts ethically responsible exploration of critical raw materials
summary: The VECTOR project, coordinated by the Helmholtz Institute Freiberg, developed efficient and low-impact exploration methods for critical raw materials including copper across Europe. The research integrates geosciences with data and social sciences to enable responsible supply of raw materials while addressing environmental and social concerns.

title: SMM #1 Refined Nickel Price on November 12
summary: On November 12, the SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged from 118,400 to 122,500 yuan/mt, with an average of 120,450 yuan/mt, down 850 yuan/mt from the previous day. The price decline reflects ongoing market adjustments.

title: SMM Nickel Midday Review: Nickel Prices Dropped Slightly on November 11
summary: On November 11, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was 119,400–123,000 yuan/mt, averaging 121,300 yuan/mt, up 100 yuan/mt from the previous trading day. The slight increase came amid expectations of continued interest rate cuts by the US Fed.

title: Nickel Futures Fall to Over 1-Month Low
summary: Nickel futures dropped to 15,078.00 USD/ton, the lowest level since September 2025, as oversupply from Indonesia continues to pressure prices. LME inventories have reached record highs, with Chinese-origin nickel now making up 65% of stocks.

title: PE eyes BHP's Nickel West as China tightens rare earth grip
summary: China's tightening control over rare earth exports has renewed global interest in nickel, especially in Australia. BHP's Nickel West, running at a loss, is up for sale with private equity and local miners showing interest. Japanese firms have also acquired stakes in Australian nickel projects aiming for competitive production costs.

title: Aqua Metals and Westwin Elements Sign LOI for U.S.-Produced Nickel Carbonate Supply
summary: Aqua Metals and Westwin Elements signed a non-binding Letter of Intent to supply up to 1,000 metric tons annually of recycled battery-grade nickel carbonate in the U.S. The agreement aims to establish one of the first domestic sources of nickel carbonate to support U.S. battery manufacturing, with deliveries targeted to start in 2027.

title: Indonesia limits new nickel permits to add value to production
summary: Indonesia has stopped approving permits for nickel plants producing certain intermediate products without further processing plans, aiming to move up the value chain. This regulation targets oversupply and encourages investment in downstream processing, potentially causing project delays or cancellations for new entrants.

title: Nickel ore stockpiles rise as smelters cut output, import from Philippines
summary: Indonesia's nickel ore stockpiles are increasing as domestic smelters reduce production and boost imports from the Philippines. This shift reflects adjustments in supply amid changing production dynamics in the nickel sector.

title: Rise in Chinese off-grid coal plants in Indonesia belies pledge to end fossil fuel support
summary: Chinese-backed coal-fired power plants, including those supporting nickel processing in Indonesia, continue to come online despite pledges to reduce fossil fuel investments. These plants are part of China's investment in Indonesia's nickel sector to supply raw materials for electric vehicle batteries, with captive coal plant capacity expected to grow significantly by 2030.

title: Nickel Asia doubles earnings to P5.19B
summary: Nickel Asia Corp. reported a doubling of its net income to P5.19 billion in the first nine months of 2025 compared to the same period last year, reflecting improved financial performance in the nickel sector.

title: Aqua Metals and Westwin Elements Sign LOI for U.S.-Produced Nickel Carbonate Supply
summary: Aqua Metals and Westwin Elements have signed a letter of intent to develop one of the first domestic sources of battery-grade nickel carbonate using advanced recycling technologies. The collaboration aims to create a fully domestic nickel supply chain from recycled feedstock to refined metal, reducing dependence on imports and strengthening U.S. manufacturing resilience.

title: Recycling technology achieves 99% purity of nickel and cobalt extracted from waste batteries
summary: Researchers from UNIST have developed an innovative electrochemical recycling technology that recovers more than 95% of nickel and cobalt from waste batteries with purity exceeding 99%. This environmentally friendly single-step process minimizes chemical usage and wastewater production compared to conventional wet recycling methods.

title: Fifth exit in 2023: Mutares has signed an agreement to sell Special Melted Products to Cogne Acciai Speciali
summary: Mutares SE & Co. KGaA signed an agreement to sell Special Melted Products Ltd. (SMP), a UK-based specialty steel and superalloy manufacturer, to Cogne Acciai Speciali S.p.A. The transaction, expected to close in Q2 2023, values SMP at approximately EUR 180 million and will strengthen Cogne Acciai Speciali's market position in high-value specialty steels.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy. This initiative aligns with the company's focus on sustainable steel production and innovation in specialty steel manufacturing.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali completes acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes GmbH
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes GmbH and its subsidiaries, expanding its footprint in stainless steel manufacturing. This acquisition is part of Cogne's strategic growth and diversification in the steel sector.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Greenland grants 30-year permit to EU-backed Molybdenum mine involving Cogne Acciai Speciali
summary: Greenland Resources secured a 30-year permit for the Malmbjerg molybdenum project, supported by the EU and involving Cogne Acciai Speciali through off-take agreements. The mine will supply critical molybdenum used to strengthen steel, benefiting sectors like aerospace and energy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali S.P.A. scheduled for ResponsibleSteel Core Site Certification audit
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali S.P.A. is set for an initial certification audit against the ResponsibleSteel International Production Standard in early December 2025, reflecting its commitment to sustainable and responsible steel production practices.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris to Commence a USD 600 million Second Tranche of its USD 1.2 Billion Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris announced the commencement of the second tranche of its share buyback program, amounting to USD 600 million, as part of its previously announced USD 1.2 billion initiative. This move reflects the company's ongoing commitment to returning value to shareholders.

title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
summary: Italy's Prysmian SpA, the world's largest copper cable maker, is applauding President Trump's planned 50% tariff on copper, stating it will bolster the American supply chain. The company, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire for $4 billion, is in regular contact with the administration ahead of the tariff's implementation on August 1.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting third-quarter revenue of €5.03 billion, exceeding consensus expectations. The Italian cable manufacturer posted strong organic growth of 9.2% and particularly strong performance in its Renewable Transmission and Power Grids segments.

title: Prysmian Cables and Systems to close Schuylkill Haven facility
summary: Prysmian Cables and Systems announced the closure of its Schuylkill Haven facility, which will affect 150 employees.

title: Prysmian shares rise as Italian cable maker seen as winner amid US copper tariffs
summary: Prysmian shares rose as much as 4% on expectations that the world's largest cable maker's large US business could benefit from US tariffs on copper.
